gobblin.data.management.copy

Class CopySource

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.source.extractor.extract.AbstractSource<String,FileAwareInputStream>
      • gobblin.data.management.copy.CopySource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Source<String,FileAwareInputStream>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CloseableFsCopySource

    public class CopySource
extends AbstractSource<String,FileAwareInputStream>
    Source that generates work units from CopyableDatasets.

    • Method Detail

      • getWorkunits

        public List<WorkUnit> getWorkunits(SourceState state)
          Does the following:
        • Instantiate a DatasetFinder.
        • Find all Dataset using DatasetFinder.
        • For each CopyableDataset get all CopyableFiles.
        • Create a WorkUnit per CopyableFile.

        In this implementation, one workunit is created for every CopyableFile found. But the extractor/converters and writers are built to support multiple CopyableFiles per workunit

        Parameters:
        state - see SourceState
        Returns:
        Work units for copying files.

      • getExtractor

        public Extractor<String,FileAwareInputStream> getExtractor(WorkUnitState state)
                                                    throws IOException
        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • setWorkUnitGuid

        public static void setWorkUnitGuid(State state,
                                   Guid guid)
                            throws IOException
        Set a unique, replicable guid for this work unit. Used for recovering partially successful work units.
        Parameters:
        state - State where guid should be written.
        guid - A byte array guid.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getWorkUnitGuid

        public static Optional<Guid> getWorkUnitGuid(State state)
                                      throws IOException
        Get guid in this state if available. This is the reverse operation of setWorkUnitGuid(gobblin.configuration.State, gobblin.util.guid.Guid).
        Parameters:
        state - State from which guid should be extracted.
        Returns:
        A byte array guid.
        Throws:
        IOException
